intro: Dipcadi monophyllum, commonly known as the single-leaved buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its single, large, waxy leaf and a single, erect stem that bears a single, yellow flower. It typically blooms during the summer months and is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
